instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3462: What is 820-3462? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.SYS_ONEWIRE: What is SYS_ONEWIRE? This is a bidirectional communication line between the system management controller(SMC) and the charger that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC. This must be working for the light to come on on the magsafe charger. .
definitions.R5280: What is R5280? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R5281: What is R5281? Pullup resistor between PP3V42_G3H and SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL which is a data line that allows the SMC to communicate with the battery and the battery charging chip. This line is necessary for the battery to be recognized. With red probe on ground, diode mode should measure 0.441 on pin 2 of this resistor. .
definitions.R7051: What is R7051? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7052: What is R7052? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message:
Received this machine with no magsafe light and no power. G3Hot was present, <SIGNAL>SYS_ONEWIRE</SIGNAL> was all good.
<CAPACITOR>C6992</CAPACITOR> corroded but tested fine. Replaced and got a light but still no power. 
<RESISTOR>R5491</RESISTOR> / <RESISTOR>R5492</RESISTOR> corroded and resistance was 180-200k on pins 4&6 of <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR>. Power in, but not out pin 3. Replaced all and got power out pin 3. (<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5482</RESISTOR>/<RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR> looked bad so they were replaced too). 
Still no power on the board. Followed pin 3 of <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> to <RESISTOR>R5499</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5498</RESISTOR>. Both looked corroded, both were replaced. While replacing <RESISTOR>R5498</RESISTOR>, I noticed that a good amount of components in the area looked slightly corroded. Cleaned and reflowed the area - board powers on now. 
Reassembled **with the correct battery screws** and all appears well. Run AST 1 and get a flag on the (A) DC in: 0.116A. Battery is not charging but is detected and in good condition. Computer runs fine, not bogged. In the OS it shows charging in the status bar, but in the system report is says "not charging".

Rechecked <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR>/<TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> - Resistance between 4&6 of <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> is 250k. <RESISTOR>R5481</RESISTOR> - 69k, <RESISTOR>R5482</RESISTOR> - 190k. (they were both at 100k before powering on). 
Followed <SIGNAL>PBUSVSENS_EN</SIGNAL> back to <RESISTOR>R7987</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7981</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7985</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7988</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7986</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7931</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7978</RESISTOR>. 
<RESISTOR>R7985</RESISTOR> pin 1 = OL V to ground, pin 2 = 0.472v to G, 20kO resistance
<RESISTOR>R7931</RESISTOR> pin 2 = 0.337v to G, pin 1 = 0.554v to G, 100kO, Pin 2 = 3.40v 
All others are between 0.4v and 0.6v to G. 

Checking around <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> for short:
<CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> measures 0.175v to G on pin 2, this follows all the way through F7040

Should I be looking at <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q7931</TRANSISTOR>, <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR>?  

Other readings:
<RESISTOR>R5491</RESISTOR>: Pin 1/2 to ground - OL, 100kO between 1&2
<RESISTOR>R5492</RESISTOR>: Pin 1 - 2.416v, Pin 2 - OL to G- 100kO between 1&2 
Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5280</RESISTOR> is 0.552
Pin 2 of <RESISTOR>R5281</RESISTOR> is 0.555

Let me know if other readings are needed. 

Also, not as important, Bluetooth is not detected in AST 1...

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: Checked resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the ISL? Known good charger and DC in board?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message:
Thanks for the quick response. 

27/28 is at 20.4 O.
17/18 is at 3.2 O. <RESISTOR>R7051</RESISTOR> - 2.4 O, <RESISTOR>R7052</RESISTOR> - 0.3 O. 

Used multiple chargers and power supply. Known good DC IN board. 

Is <CAPACITOR>C7025</CAPACITOR> measuring 0.175v to G on pin 2 normal?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: Will replace <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> and get back.. Any way of testing before replacing or is this a common known failure point?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: If you replaced 7055 replace 7030 and the ISL all at the same time

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message: First thing I would suspect is the battery, can still be faulty even if it reports as working fine.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3462</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not charging, battery detected - shows charging in status bar
threads.message:
Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> and ISL.. nothing. Tried a new battery.. same. 
I noticed that if I switched from the power supply to a MagSafe (or between chargers), the light wouldn't come on until an SMC reset. Decided to try another ISL.. that was it. Third one was the charm. Works with all chargers and both batteries now. 

Thanks for the help everyone. SOLVED! This model is almost as fun as the TouchBars..
